intro: Lobelia acutangula, commonly known as the sharp-angled lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and typically grows in moist, wooded areas. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces spikes of blue to violet flowers. It is often found in swampy or wetland habitats, where it thrives in the humid, shaded environment. Lobelia acutangula is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
